txt.en:
'You do not want your share?'

Drúgred's eyes wander to the nearby piles of gold, and he appears dumbstruck by your decision.

'Truly, our ways are different... but I cannot begrudge you. You have done much for us, and that is to be commended. You have the bearing of a great warrior, and your allies are lucky to count you among them... even if their cause is nigh hopeless.

'Here, take these supplies. We can finish our journey without them, and you still have a battle to fight.'
With their foes slain and the wealth of the Khundolar in their grasp, the Variags have decided to return to Khand once their final errand is finished.

'So what shall it be, [placeholder]?'

You tell Jarl Gurthilm that while his offer is generous, you do not wish to accept your share of the gold.

'I had a suspicion, and a small amount of hope, that you would refuse my offer. Your sense of duty is unfailing, [placeholder], and none should think less of you for honouring it. 

Besides, I shall have the shares sorted anew without yours, and my men and I shall be the richer for it!

'Speak with Drúgred, and he shall give you something to help you on your way. Not gold, mind you... but we're not heartless.'

Drúgred can be found to the south-east of Aragorn's camp on the border of Dagorlad.\n\nYou have chosen to forgo your share of the gold, but Drúgred will offer you a meagre amount of supplies in return.
